example.eg: I'm ordering you to put that money back and apologize.
example.egtrans: 我在命令你，把钱放回去，向人道歉。

example.eg: We should order another bottle of wine.
example.egtrans: 我们该再要一瓶酒。

example.eg: Have you ordered yet?
example.egtrans: 您点过菜了吗？

example.eg: The boss's orders are for everyone to switch immediately to the urgent project and stop work on anything else until it's finished.
example.egtrans: 老板的命令是让每个人立即去处理紧急事项，在完成前，停下其他一切工作。

example.eg: The general's order was to attack immediately.
example.egtrans: 将军的命令是即刻展开进攻。

example.eg: He listed off their names in alphabetical order.
example.egtrans: 他按字母顺序列出了他们的名字。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 顺序, 次序, 排序

example.eg: Are these books in any particular order?
example.egtrans: 这些书的摆放有什么讲究么？

example.eg: The Second World War gave rise to a new world order.
example.egtrans: 二战带来了新的世界格局。

example.eg: Society cannot function without order.
example.egtrans: 一个社会没有规矩就无法运行。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 秩序, 规矩, 制度

example.eg: Has the waiter taken your order?
example.egtrans: 侍者请您点过菜了吗？

trans_examp.trans_cn: 点菜, 点的菜, 叫的食物

example.eg: By order of the King, the prisoners were set free.
example.egtrans: 国王下令，大赦天下。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 命令, 法令, 政令

example.eg: He joined an order of Freemasons.
example.egtrans: 他加入了共济会。

example.eg: The lower orders of society always suffer most from war.
example.egtrans: 饱受战争之苦的永远都是社会的底级阶层。

example.eg: I have sent you my order for a new table.
He wore his orders proudly on the breast of his jacket.
example.egtrans: 他骄傲地将勋章挂在胸前。

example.eg: Their cooking is of the highest order.
example.egtrans: 他们厨艺的品质是一流的。

example.eg: I don't like behaviour of that order.
example.egtrans: 我不欣赏那种行为。

example.eg: The judge issued an order requiring him to pay the debt in full.
St Francis established the order of friars named after him in 1209.
example.egtrans: 圣弗朗西斯于1209年成立了以自己名字命名的修道会。

example.eg: Foxes and bears are of the same order, but not the same family.
example.egtrans: 狐狸与熊同目，但不同科。

example.eg: This book has pictures of the Ionic, Doric and Corinthian orders.
example.egtrans: 这本书有爱奥尼、多利安、科林斯三种柱式的图片。

dsense.name: orders
dsense.guideword: (Christianity: clergy ranks) (基督教: 神职人员等级)

example.eg: He prefers to order than to obey.
example.egtrans: 比起服从，他更喜欢下达命令。

example.eg: The judge ordered that he stay away from the victim.
He ordered the files according to date.
The doctor ordered a week's bed rest.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 嘱咐, 开...的处方, 开出...药

example.eg: Don't try to order me around; you aren't my boss.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不断对…发号施令, 将…差来遣去

example.eg: I'm too tired to cook tonight, so let's just order out.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 准备点餐了吗？，可以点菜了吗？

example.eg: If your item is not in stock, the company will place a back order for you.

trans_examp.trans_cn: （因无现货）有待日后交付的货物, 有待日后发货的订单

example.eg: The firm placed a call-off order with the supplier.
The cooked-to-order breakfast at our hotel is excellent.
He has to pay child support by court order.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 法院指令, 法庭庭谕
执行命令, 行政命令

example.eg: Most fraternal orders are social organizations providing service to the community.
The professor's notes had got out of order and he was having trouble giving his lecture.

dsense.name: in alphabetical order
dsense.guideword: (by initial letter according to the alphabet)

example.eg: My CD collection is arranged in alphabetical order.

dsense.name: in alphabetical order
dsense.guideword: (organized by initial letter according to the alphabet)

example.eg: Please put the cards in order.  Could you put these files in order, please?
example.egtrans: 请按顺序摆放卡片。能请您按顺序排列这些文件么？

trans_examp.trans_cn: 按顺序地, 有次序地, 井然有序地

example.eg: The office manager wanted to make sure that everything was in order.
example.egtrans: 办公室主任想要确保所有的事情都井然有序。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 按顺序的, 依照次序的, 井然有序的

example.eg: Hello, you two! I hear congratulations are in order!
example.egtrans: 喂！听说你俩有喜事该贺啊！

example.eg: Security agents looked at my papers and told me that all was in order.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 合规的, 符合要求的

example.eg: In order for sales to be strong, our department needs to work hard this month.
The company is designing each store in order that customers may shop comfortably and conveniently.
example.egtrans: 这家公司正在给每一间商店进行设计，为了让顾客能够舒心、便利地购物。

example.eg: You don't need a degree in order to work as an escort.
example.egtrans: 为了成为一名护卫队成员，你不需要获得任何学位。//要想出国旅游，你必须持有有效的护照。

example.eg: I went to the shop in order to buy some milk.
example.egtrans: 我去商店为了买一些牛奶。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 按照预期顺序, 按照计划顺序

example.eg: After I took my car to the mechanic, everything seemed to be in running order.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 正常运转, 正常运作

example.eg: You'd better check your parachute's in working order before you jump.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 正常运作地, 能正常发挥功能地

example.eg: The government sent troops to restore law and order to areas where violence had broken out.
Clothes that are made to order ought to fit better than off-the-rack clothes.
Mail order has seen stiff competition from online merchants in the Internet age.

dsense.name: mail-order bride
dsense.guideword: informal, pejorative (woman marrying wealthy foreign man) (贬义)

example.eg: Since he did not like the desks he found for sale, he had one made to order for his new office.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 定制，定做, 汇票, 汇款单

example.eg: Please send your payment by check or money order.  Many companies sell money orders, but only the postal service sells postal orders.
Please list your preferences in numerical order.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 数字顺序, 号码顺序, 号码顺序, 已下单的，已订购的

dsense.name: on the order of [sb], on the orders of [sb], on [sb]'s orders

trans_examp.trans_cn: 按...的指令, 按...的要求

dsense.name: on the order of [sth] (US), of the order of [sth] (UK)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 以...的程度, 以...的严重性

dsense.name: on the order of (US), of the order of, in the order of (UK)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 大致的, 大约的, 与...相近的

example.eg: The order book showed that the new deckchair was a popular product.
I'll need to fill out an order form for more printer cartridges.

dsense.name: order of succession
dsense.guideword: (formula determining successor to vacated office or position)

example.eg: The order of succession meant that Edward VI would become King when his father died.
The order of the day always starts with the flag salute at our school.
Pessimism seems to be the order of the day round here.
The sign on the door of the toilet cubicle read "out of order".
Terry's rude comments about your brother were out of order.
You were out of order last night; I think you need to call our guests today to apologise.
I dropped my manuscript and now the pages are all out of order.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 次序混乱的, 顺序颠倒的

example.eg: The judge ruled the prosecutor's question out of order.
My first job at the office was making the tea. I was at the bottom of the pecking order.
Please call the Chinese restaurant and place an order for hot and sour soup.
example.egtrans: 请给中餐馆打电话，并下一份酸辣汤的订单。

example.eg: To pay, please send a cheque or postal order.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 邮政汇款单, 邮政汇票

example.eg: The library pre-orders its books so they are ready by publication day.
We have received your purchase order and will dispatch the goods immediately.
The pages of the manuscript were muddled up so I had to put them in order.
Before he died, my father was careful to put all his affairs in order.
Jellyfish got caught in the pipes and put the pump out of order.
The Benedictines are a very old religious order.
I was so delighted with their goods that I've already put in a repeat order.
She got a restraining order against her ex-boyfriend.
My grandmother set all her affairs in order shortly before she died.
You'll need to set your house in order before you embark on something so ambitious.
I created a standing order with my bank to pay my landlord every month.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 委托银行按期付款的委托书

example.eg: I had a standing order with the bakery for a dozen croissants every Saturday.

dsense.name: take an order
dsense.guideword: (serving staff: write down food requested) (餐厅)

example.eg: Translate 300 legal pages in three days? That's a pretty tall order.
example.egtrans: 三天内翻译300页法律文书？这个要求未免也太高了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 苛刻的要求, 过高要求, 艰巨的任务

example.eg: All our breads and pastries are baked to order.
Word order in English is more important than in some other languages.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 工作指令, 工作要求
